overview: Geraldine has ten years Industrial experience gained in both multinational and start up companies spanning the pharmaceutical and Ag-Biotech sectors. She joined the University in 1994 as Business Manager for Prof. Chris Lowe at the Institute of Biotechnology and later moved to the Technology Transfer Office. Geraldine moved to the Challenge Fund in 2000 as Investment Manager and stepped up to Head the Cambridge Enterprise Seed Funds in September 2007 with responsibility for managing two portfolios comprising 40 companies across all technology sectors. She has a first degree in Microbiology, a PhD in Biochemistry and holds the full FSA Investment Management Certificate. Geraldine is a former lecturer on the University’s Masters of Bioscience Enterprise programme.
